answers.answer: I would tell the doctor that treats him for Alzheimer's.  My mother had this disease, and we went to the one doctor for everything until she went to the nursing home, then they had a doctor there.I wish you luck.  I know how horrible it is to deal with.

question: My husband is 76, an Alzheimer's patient, history of diabetes, macular degeneration, heart disease, has been diagnosed with sixth nerve palsy of left eye.  What is the treatment for this problem?  We have an appt with an opthomologist plastic surgeon.  This was suggested by our opthomologist.  Should we be seeing a neurologist for this problem?
title: treatment for sixth nerve palsy
